title: Mary Broome
creator: Allan Monkhouse
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
description: LibriVox recording of Mary Broome, by Allan Monkhouse. Read by a full cast. Before Downton Abbey, there was Mary Broome. In Allan Monkhouse's 1911 satire, when the son of a middle-class household gets their housemaid pregnant, the two families must try to combine their very different values. (Summary by wildemoose) Cast: Sheila Ray: Grace Ada Timbrell: Charlotte Duckett Edgar Timbrell: mb Mary Broome: Arielle Lipshaw Leonard Timbrell: bala Mrs. Timbrell: Elizabeth Klett Edward Timbrell: ToddHW Maid: Beth Thomas Mr. Pendleton: CalmDragon Mrs. Pendleton: Tara Dow Mrs. Greaves: Availle John Broome: John Steigerwald Mrs. Broome: CaprishaPage Narrator: MaryAnn Spiegel Audio edited by Arielle Lipshaw For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. Download M4B (52MB)
subject: librivox; literature; audiobook; drama; monkhouse; mary broome
